thread.title: Korean Restaurants Venture Beyond Kimchi

author: Charles Passy
title: Korean Restaurants Venture Beyond Kimchi
text:
For years, New Yorkers who patronized the growing number of Korean restaurants in the city knew what to expect: A plentiful menu that featured the traditional table-side barbecue dishes, including bulgogi and kalbi, as the centerpiece. And the drink of choice? Korean beer or the clear, Korean spirit known as soju.
But customers at Osamil, a year-old Midtown Manhattan Korean dining spot not far from heart of the Koreatown neighborhood, have a different set of options. Say, a Korean-inspired version of bouillabaisse, the classic...
